intro: Chrysanthemum leucanthemum var. maximum, commonly known as the oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow center surrounded by white ray florets, forming a daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous small, yellow disk flowers in the center. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils. This species is known for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
